page.title: 04MIXED AGRICULTURE
page.content: In this area farming covers three sections:- {Arable.}The main crops being Barley and Wheat, some sown in Autumn and some in the Spring.A new crop of Oil Seed Rape is also being sown. A small acreage is used for root crops such as potatoes and turnips. A small area is also used for the growing of peas. {Grassland.}A proportion of this is cut for silage and hay, leaving the rest as permanent pasture and rough grazing {Stock.}Breeds of sheep are North Country Cheviots, Suffolks and some half bred ewes. Some sheep are overwintered in large sheds. Lambing and shearing takes place in the sheds. Sheep are dipped twice a year against maggots and sheep scab according to Ministry regulations. Cattle on the whole are cross bred cattle. {One farm}specialises in dairy farming.
